**iOS 10** is the [tenth major release](/wiki/IOS_version_history "IOS version
history") of the [iOS](/wiki/IOS "IOS") [mobile operating
system](/wiki/Mobile_operating_system "Mobile operating system") developed by
[Apple Inc.](/wiki/Apple_Inc. "Apple Inc."), being the successor to [iOS
9](/wiki/IOS_9 "IOS 9"). It was announced at the company's [Worldwide
Developers Conference](/wiki/Apple_Worldwide_Developers_Conference "Apple
Worldwide Developers Conference") on June 13, 2016, and was released on
September 13, 2016. It was succeeded by [iOS 11](/wiki/IOS_11 "IOS 11") on
September 19, 2017.[3]

iOS 10 incorporates changes to [3D Touch](/wiki/3D_Touch "3D Touch") and the
lock screen. There are new features to some apps:
[Messages](/wiki/Messages_\(Apple\) "Messages \(Apple\)") has additional
[emojis](/wiki/Emoji "Emoji") and third-party apps can extend functionality in
iMessage, [Maps](/wiki/Apple_Maps "Apple Maps") has a redesigned interface and
additional third-party functions, the Home app manages "HomeKit"-enabled
accessories, [Photos](/wiki/Photos_\(Apple\) "Photos \(Apple\)") has
algorithmic search and categorization of media known as "Memories", and
[Siri](/wiki/Siri "Siri") is compatible with third-party app-specific
requests, such as starting workouts apps, sending
[IMs](/wiki/Instant_messaging "Instant messaging"), requesting the
[Lyft](/wiki/Lyft "Lyft") or [Uber](/wiki/Uber_\(company\) "Uber \(company\)")
apps or to use payment functions.

Reviews of iOS 10 were mostly positive. Reviewers highlighted the significant
updates to iMessage, Siri, Photos, 3D Touch, and the lock screen as welcome
changes. The third-party extension support to iMessage meant it was "becoming
a platform", although the user interface was criticized for being difficult to
understand. Third-party integration in Siri was "great", although the voice
assistant was criticized for not having become smarter than before. Reviewers
were impressed with the image recognition technology in Photos, although
noting it was still a "work in progress" with a higher error rate than the
competition. 3D Touch "finally feels useful" and "works in almost every part
of the OS". The lock screen was "far more customizable than before", and
reviewers enjoyed that notification bubbles could be expanded to see more
information without needing to unlock the phone.

A month after release, iOS 10 was installed on 54% of iOS devices, a "slightly
slower migration" than for the release of iOS 9, speculated as being caused by
an early release issue that may have "put some [users] off downloading the
update". User adoption of iOS 10 steadily increased in the following months,
eventually totaling 89% of active devices in September 2017.

## History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=1 "Edit
section: History")]

Further information: [iOS version history § iOS
10](/wiki/IOS_version_history#iOS_10 "IOS version history")

### Introduction and initial
release[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section:
Introduction and initial release")]

iOS 10 was introduced at the [Apple Worldwide Developers
Conference](/wiki/Apple_Worldwide_Developers_Conference "Apple Worldwide
Developers Conference") keynote address on June 13, 2016.[4] The first beta
release was made available to registered developers following the keynote.[5]
Apple released the first public beta release on July 7, 2016.[6]

iOS 10 was officially released on September 13, 2016.[7]

### Updates[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=3 "Edit
section: Updates")]

#### 10.0.1[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=4 "Edit
section: 10.0.1")]

iOS 10.0.1 was released on September 13, 2016, as the first update to iOS 10.
It was released just after 10.0, which contained a bug causing devices to
[brick](/wiki/Brick_\(electronics\) "Brick \(electronics\)") themselves while
updating.[8][9]

#### 10.0.2[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=5 "Edit
section: 10.0.2")]

iOS 10.0.2 was released on September 23, 2016. The update contained bug fixes,
specifically fixing a bug that temporarily disabled the headphone controls on
the Lightning EarPods that ship with the [iPhone 7](/wiki/IPhone_7 "IPhone
7"), fixing a bug preventing app extensions from being enabled, and fixing an
unexpected crash of the Photos app when activating [iCloud Photo
Library](/wiki/ICloud#iCloud_Photo_Library "ICloud").[10][11]

#### 10.0.3[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=6 "Edit
section: 10.0.3")]

iOS 10.0.3 was released on October 17, 2016 exclusively for [iPhone
7](/wiki/IPhone_7 "IPhone 7") and [iPhone 7 Plus](/wiki/IPhone_7 "IPhone 7")
models, with a fix for connectivity issues.[12]

#### 10.1[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=7 "Edit
section: 10.1")]

iOS 10.1 was released on October 24, 2016, with a new [portrait camera
mode](/wiki/Bokeh "Bokeh") for iPhone 7 Plus, transit directions for
[Japan](/wiki/Japan "Japan") in Apple Maps, the ability to replay Bubble and
Screen effects in iMessage, as well as lots of bug fixes.[13] iOS 10.1 also
features a warning message when launching a [32-bit](/wiki/32-bit "32-bit")
app, that says the app "may slow down your iPhone".[14] iOS 10.1 also allows
users to use [iMessage](/wiki/IMessage "IMessage") effects even when the
"Reduce Motion" setting is turned on.[15]

#### 10.1.1[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=8 "Edit
section: 10.1.1")]

iOS 10.1.1 was released on October 31, 2016, with a fix for an issue where
[Health](/wiki/Health_\(Apple\) "Health \(Apple\)") data could not be viewed
for some users.[16]

On November 9, 2016, Apple released a new version of iOS 10.1.1, only
available for users who hadn't yet updated to the previous 10.1.1 update. No
information on the new update was given.[17]

#### 10.2[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=9 "Edit
section: 10.2")]

iOS 10.2 was released on December 12, 2016. The update included a new "TV" app
(U.S. only) that unifies content from different video apps, and recommends new
TV shows and movies to watch. The update also added new and redesigned emoji,
stabilization and photo grouping accuracy changes to Photos, new "Love" and
"Celebration" Messages screen effects, notification support for HomeKit-
accessories, as well as revamped sorting options and design tweaks in the
Music app.[18] iOS 10.2 also adds a [telemetry](/wiki/Telemetry "Telemetry")
diagnostic tool that Apple can use to report battery consumption, for
diagnosing reported issues with 30% battery shutdowns on some iPhone
models.[19] iOS 10.2 also includes three new wallpapers for [iPhone
7](/wiki/IPhone_7 "IPhone 7") and [iPhone 7 Plus](/wiki/IPhone_7 "IPhone 7"),
specifically the wallpapers featured in the marketing of the phones.[20]

#### 10.2.1[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=10 "Edit
section: 10.2.1")]

iOS 10.2.1 was released on January 23, 2017, with bug fixes and security
improvements.[21]

On December 28, 2017 Apple acknowledged that this update changed the power
management during peak workloads to avoid unexpected shutdowns on iPhone 6,
iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6s, iPhone 6s Plus, and iPhone SE.[22] Customers were
upset over this update; some thought it was a ploy to get people to upgrade to
new devices. A number of people have filed lawsuits over the feature and are
seeking class action status.[23]

#### 10.3[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=11 "Edit
section: 10.3")]

iOS 10.3 was released on March 27, 2017. The update introduced a "Find My
[AirPods](/wiki/AirPods "AirPods")" feature for lost AirPods headphones,
changed the default [file system](/wiki/File_system "File system") from
[HFS+](/wiki/HFS_Plus "HFS Plus") to [APFS](/wiki/Apple_File_System "Apple
File System") for improved performance and [encryption](/wiki/Encryption
"Encryption") (also increases usable storage on the device),[24][25] support
for additional [Siri](/wiki/Siri "Siri") actions, including status of bills in
payment apps and scheduling with ride-booking apps, a new [Apple
ID](/wiki/Apple_ID "Apple ID") view in Settings, the ability for developers to
respond to reviews in the [App Store](/wiki/App_Store_\(iOS\) "App Store
\(iOS\)") as well as "Helpful" and "Not Helpful" review labels, improved
overview of [iCloud](/wiki/ICloud "ICloud") storage usage, and bug fixes and
stability improvements.[26] Users can also give app ratings inside the app
itself.[27] iOS 10.3 also features a significant [security
patch](/wiki/Patch_\(computing\) "Patch \(computing\)") fixing an issue where
a [JavaScript](/wiki/JavaScript "JavaScript") exploit link would cause devices
to repeatedly call the [9-1-1](/wiki/9-1-1 "9-1-1") emergency phone
number.[28][29][30] The update also added a Podcasts widget and made app
transitions smoother,[31] and extended support for [Wi-Fi calling](/wiki/Wi-
Fi_calling "Wi-Fi calling") to more carriers.[32] For CarPlay, the update
added a quick-access multitasking screen with the three most recently used
apps,[33] and added functionality for the Maps app to find [electric vehicle
charging stations](/wiki/Electric_vehicle_charging_stations "Electric vehicle
charging stations").[34][35]

#### 10.3.1[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=12 "Edit
section: 10.3.1")]

iOS 10.3.1 was released on April 3, 2017, with bug fixes and security
improvements, including a fix for a [Wi-Fi](/wiki/Wi-Fi "Wi-Fi")
vulnerability[36] discovered by [Google's](/wiki/Google "Google") [Project
Zero](/wiki/Project_Zero_\(Google\) "Project Zero \(Google\)") team of
security researchers.[37]

#### 10.3.2[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=13 "Edit
section: 10.3.2")]

iOS 10.3.2 was released on May 15, 2017, with bug fixes and security
improvements.[38][39]

#### 10.3.3[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=14 "Edit
section: 10.3.3")]

iOS 10.3.3 was released on July 19, 2017, with new wallpapers for the
[12.9-inch iPad Pro](/wiki/IPad_Pro "IPad Pro"),[40] along with bug fixes and
security improvements,[41] including a fix for a [Wi-Fi](/wiki/Wi-Fi "Wi-Fi")
vulnerability in which devices searching for signal were open to
hackers.[42][43][44]

## System features[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=15
"Edit section: System features")]

### Control Center[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=16
"Edit section: Control Center")]

The [Control Center](/wiki/Control_Center_\(iOS\) "Control Center \(iOS\)")
has been redesigned and split into three pages: one for general settings, such
as quick toggles for [airplane mode](/wiki/Airplane_mode "Airplane mode") and
orientation lock, one for audio controls and one for controlling
[HomeKit](/wiki/HomeKit "HomeKit") ([internet of
things](/wiki/Internet_of_things "Internet of things")) appliances, if
used.[45]

3D Touch capabilities have been added to several toggles.[46]

### Home screen[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=17 "Edit
section: Home screen")]

Apps can show a [widget](/wiki/Software_widget "Software widget") when their
home-screen icon is accessed with 3D Touch.[47]

Most default apps included with iOS devices can be hidden from the home screen
and 're-downloaded' from the [App Store](/wiki/App_Store_\(iOS\) "App Store
\(iOS\)"). Upon doing this, the [sandbox](/wiki/Sandbox_\(computer_security\)
"Sandbox \(computer security\)") of the respective app is removed, which
contains user data, settings and [caches](/wiki/Cache_\(computing\) "Cache
\(computing\)"). The app is also hidden from other places, such as the "Today"
view, the Settings app and "Share Sheets", through which the user can interact
with the app from within another app.[46][48][49] This feature was first
hinted at during an interview in September 2015, in which Apple CEO [Tim
Cook](/wiki/Tim_Cook "Tim Cook") stated that Apple was "looking at" allowing
customers to remove unused stock apps.[50]

iOS 10 allows users to prioritize certain app downloads by using 3D
Touch.[51][52]

### Keyboard[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=18 "Edit
section: Keyboard")]

QuickType virtual keyboards, which provide [word-
completion](/wiki/Autocomplete "Autocomplete") capabilities, can predict
answers to questions and suggest relevant information based on location,
calendar availability or contacts.[53]

The "Define" feature in previous iOS versions has been replaced by "Look Up",
and now expands its use from just providing definitions to retrieving
information from locations, web browsing history, downloaded apps, suggested
websites, and more.[54][55][56]

The QuickType keyboard will allow the user to type in multiple languages if
the user selects the desired languages in the "Dictionary" and "Keyboard"
settings menus.[57]

The user has the ability to change keyboard settings specifically for physical
keyboards (such as autocorrect and auto-capitalization).[58][59]

### Lock screen[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=19 "Edit
section: Lock screen")]

The "slide to unlock" mechanism on the [lock screen](/wiki/Lock_screen "Lock
screen") has been removed in favor of pressing the home button.[60]

Similar to the feature on the [Apple Watch](/wiki/Apple_Watch "Apple Watch"),
"Raise to Wake" wakes up the device when the user lifts it.[61] This function
requires a device with an [M9 motion
coprocessor](/wiki/Apple_motion_coprocessors "Apple motion coprocessors") or
newer.[62]

The "Today" view of Notification Center has been replaced by widgets, and is
accessible by swiping from left to right.[46] On the iPad, widgets can be
displayed in a two-column layout.[58]

### Notification
Center[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=20 "Edit section:
Notification Center")]

The Notification Center no longer has a "Today" view.[63]

Notifications, now larger,[64] can expand to display more information and all
unread notifications can be cleared at once, using 3D Touch.[65]

Apps that need to be updated frequently can now have notifications that update
live.[66][67]

The Notification Center contains a Spotlight search bar.[68]

### Settings[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=21 "Edit
section: Settings")]

A new Magnifier setting was added which allows users to triple-click the home
button and iOS will open the Camera app with magnification on.[69][70][71][72]

There are also new "Color Filters" settings to compensate for a user's [color
blindness](/wiki/Color_blindness "Color blindness").[73] Color Filters options
include grayscale, red/green filter for [protanopia](/wiki/Protanopia
"Protanopia"), green/red filter for [deuteranopia](/wiki/Deuteranopia
"Deuteranopia"), and blue/yellow filter for [tritanopia](/wiki/Tritanopia
"Tritanopia").[74]

For the Messages application, users can now turn on Low Quality Image mode,
which saves "your poor iPhone from stuffing itself full of images" based on
new animated stickers and GIFs that can be sent in iMessage.[59]

The Wi-Fi menu in Settings now shows warnings about the security of a network
and if a network is not connected to the [Internet](/wiki/Internet
"Internet"). This is shown to the user as small subtext under the Wi-Fi's
network's name.[75]

"Raise to Wake" can be enabled or disabled in Settings.[76]

In iOS 10.2, a "Preserve Settings" feature allows users to set up the Camera
app to launch with certain settings by default. Options include launching with
the Video or Square mode rather than the Photo mode, preserving the last used
filter, and preserving the capture settings for Live Photos.[77]

Music added to Apple Music on one device can now be automatically downloaded
to other devices using the Automatic downloads setting.[78]

The Settings allows the user the option to have routes in the Maps app avoid
[toll roads](/wiki/Toll_road "Toll road")[79] and/or [highways](/wiki/Highway
"Highway").[80]

In iOS 10.3, Settings was updated to feature information relating to a user's
[Apple ID](/wiki/Apple_ID "Apple ID") account in the main menu,[81][82] and
features a section that allows users to see which old, unmaintained apps won't
work in future versions of iOS.[83] Additionally, users can now see a
breakdown of their iCloud storage.[26][84]

The user can enable a setting to have Siri announce who's calling, with
options for "Always", "Headphones & Car", "Headphones Only", and "Never".[85]

#### CarPlay[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=22 "Edit
section: CarPlay")]

iOS 10 now allows users to rearrange and remove apps from their
[CarPlay](/wiki/CarPlay "CarPlay") display, through Settings.[86][87]

In iOS 10.3, Maps on CarPlay added [electric vehicle charging
stations](/wiki/Electric_vehicle_charging_stations "Electric vehicle charging
stations").[34]

### Universal
Clipboard[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=23 "Edit
section: Universal Clipboard")]

As part of the overall [Continuity](/wiki/IOS_8#Continuity "IOS 8") features
introduced in [iOS 8](/wiki/IOS_8 "IOS 8"), a new Universal Clipboard feature
allows users of [Mac](/wiki/Macintosh "Macintosh") personal computers running
[macOS Sierra](/wiki/MacOS_Sierra "MacOS Sierra") and [iOS](/wiki/IOS "IOS")
devices running iOS 10 to easily copy material to and from different devices
through [iCloud](/wiki/ICloud "ICloud").[88][89]

As part of Continuity, a new "Continuity Keyboard" feature allows users to
type text on an iPhone and have the text appear on an [Apple
TV](/wiki/Apple_TV "Apple TV") running [tvOS](/wiki/TvOS "TvOS") 10, avoiding
the Siri Remote for text input.[90]

### Other changes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=24
"Edit section: Other changes")]

iOS 10 features new sound effects for locking the device and for keyboard
clicks.[71][91]

Whenever a device detects liquid in the
[Lightning](/wiki/Lightning_\(connector\) "Lightning \(connector\)") port, a
notice warns the user to disconnect the Lightning cable and allow the port to
dry.[92][93]

iOS 10 also allows [TTY](/wiki/Telecommunications_device_for_the_deaf
"Telecommunications device for the deaf") calls to be made without any
additional hardware.[94]

iOS 10 allows users to find their [Apple Watch](/wiki/Apple_Watch "Apple
Watch") using [Find My iPhone](/wiki/Find_My_iPhone "Find My iPhone").[95]

[Spotlight](/wiki/Spotlight_\(software\) "Spotlight \(software\)") can now
search the contents of users' [iCloud Drive](/wiki/ICloud_Drive "ICloud
Drive").[96]

Storage is reported to the user in the base 10 (1 [kilobyte](/wiki/Kilobyte
"Kilobyte") equals 1000 [bytes](/wiki/Byte "Byte")) format instead of base 2,
which was used in older iOS versions.[97]

## App features[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=25 "Edit
section: App features")]

### App Store[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=26 "Edit
section: App Store")]

iOS 10 allows developers to buy advertisement spots in the [App
Store](/wiki/App_Store_\(iOS\) "App Store \(iOS\)") when users search for
content.[98][99] It also adds back the "Categories" section, which replaces
the "Explore" section introduced in [iOS 8](/wiki/IOS_8 "IOS 8").[100]

In iOS 10.3, developers are able to respond to user reviews,[101] and
"Helpful" and "Not Helpful" review labels can help surface the most relevant
customer reviews.[26]

### Calendar[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=27 "Edit
section: Calendar")]

In iOS 10, users can now change what day of the week the calendar starts on,
as well as alert settings for birthdays and events, and calendar type
([Gregorian](/wiki/Gregorian_calendar "Gregorian calendar"),
[Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_calendar "Chinese calendar"),
[Hebrew](/wiki/Hebrew_calendar "Hebrew calendar"),
[Islamic](/wiki/Islamic_calendar "Islamic calendar")).[102]

### Camera[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=28 "Edit
section: Camera")]

Music will no longer stop playing when the Camera app is launched, unless
users decide to record a video or Live Photo.[103]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/e3/IOS_Clock_app_screenshot.png/220px-
IOS_Clock_app_screenshot.png)](/wiki/File:IOS_Clock_app_screenshot.png)

[](/wiki/File:IOS_Clock_app_screenshot.png "Enlarge")

The analog stopwatch face

Live Photos can be taken with filters (previously only available for still
photos).[104][105]

In iOS 10.1, the [iPhone 7 Plus](/wiki/IPhone_7 "IPhone 7") received a new
depth of field portrait camera mode, using both the wide-angle and telephoto
lenses on the phone to "create shallow depth of field portrait photos with
blurred backgrounds".[13]

### Clock[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=29 "Edit
section: Clock")]

The [Clock](/wiki/Clock_\(iOS_app\) "Clock \(iOS app\)") app now has a dark
theme.[106][107]

A new "Bedtime" feature reminds the user when to go to bed to get the desired
amount of sleep.[108][109] There is also a new stopwatch face, accessed by
swiping to the left.[70][79]

### Contacts[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=30 "Edit
section: Contacts")]

The Contacts app in iOS 10 allows users to set default phone numbers and email
addresses for contacts who have multiple numbers or addresses.[110] The app
also allows the user to add and remove contacts from the Favorite Contacts
list.[111]

### Home[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=31 "Edit
section: Home")]

Home is a new app that allows users to manage appliances compatible with
HomeKit, Apple's [API](/wiki/Application_programming_interface "Application
programming interface") for [home automation](/wiki/Home_automation "Home
automation").[67] In the app, users can add compatible HomeKit accessories,
such as locks, lights, and thermostats, and then directly control the
appliances through the app.[112]

A "Scenes" panel allows many devices to be controlled at once to fit a mood or
setting.[108] [Geo-fencing](/wiki/Geo-fence "Geo-fence") activates scheduled
sequences following the user's location.[60]

### Mail[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=32 "Edit
section: Mail")]

The [Mail](/wiki/Mail_\(Apple\) "Mail \(Apple\)") app now allows users to
unsubscribe from mailing lists with an Unsubscribe button.[108][113][114]
Users can dismiss the message to unsubscribe for a particular mailing list by
tapping the "X" at the top right corner, preventing the Mail app from
displaying the unsubscribe button for that mailing list again later.[115]

Apple has added back support for [HTML5](/wiki/HTML5 "HTML5") video in Mail,
which was previously stopped in [iOS 8](/wiki/IOS_8 "IOS 8").[116]

Mail can filter messages, either by unread/read, or by categories.[78][117]

iOS 10 also changes how email [threading](/wiki/Conversation_threading
"Conversation threading") works, by placing the oldest email at the top by
default. An option in Settings lets users revert to the previous threading
system with the most recent message on top.[118][119] Additionally, the new
threaded conversations allow users to tap a message to see a scrollable stream
of messages inside the thread.[56]

### Maps[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=33 "Edit
section: Maps")]

[Maps](/wiki/Apple_Maps "Apple Maps") has been redesigned and updated with
additional features, including scanning calendar events for locations,
[learning from a user's typical actions](/wiki/Machine_learning "Machine
learning"), and a redesigned driving view.[120]

A marker can be automatically placed to indicate the user's parked
car.[121][122][123] The marker can also tell the user when they last parked
their car, and a Notes field allows the user to enter information, such as
parking garage number, in the app.[124]

The app now helps users find the nearest gas station, fast-food restaurant or
coffee shop, by swiping up from the bottom of the screen. Maps also estimates
how long the detour will take.[125]

Users can add third-party extensions to the Maps app, which enable additional
functionality, such as a restaurant-booking extension can help the user
reserve a table from inside the Maps app.[126]

Users can now pan and zoom while in navigation mode.[127]

The app displays the current [temperature](/wiki/Temperature "Temperature")
and weather conditions in the bottom right corner.[128] In iOS 10.3, the app
also allows the user to see a weather forecast by using 3D Touch on the
current temperature.[129][83] This functionality allows users to see an hour-
by-hour breakdown of the area that they are looking at.[130]

### Messages[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=34 "Edit
section: Messages")]

The [Messages](/wiki/Messages_\(Apple\) "Messages \(Apple\)") app incorporates
its own App Store, which lets users download third-party iMessage apps that
can be accessed within iMessage conversations. Users can use them to send
[stickers](/wiki/Sticker_\(Internet\) "Sticker \(Internet\)"), play games or
send [rich content](/wiki/Rich_content "Rich content"), such as media
previews, to recipients.[131] The Messages App Store has three navigation
fields: Featured, Categories, and Manage.[132][133]

The app has been updated to include many visual effects. Chat bubbles, for
example, can be sent with a "loud" or "gentle" animation that the recipient
sees upon receiving. "Invisible ink" effect obscures the message until the
recipient swipes across it. Full-screen effects like balloons, confetti or
fireworks can be sent. There is also support for interactions similar to the
Apple Watch, such as sending quick sketches and recording and sending the
user's heartbeat.[60][46][134] In order to use the screen and bubble effects,
the Reduce Motion setting needs to be turned off.[135][136]

Messages now allows users to send handwritten notes.[72] This is done by
turning the device to landscape mode for iPhones (landscape or portrait for
[iPad](/wiki/IPad "IPad") users) and then tapping the handwriting
squiggle.[137] The Messages app automatically saves recently used notes, to
make it easier to send them again. A handwritten message can be deleted in the
same way an app is deleted; by holding down on the message and pressing
Delete.[138] The message can also be saved as a picture file.[139]

New [emojis](/wiki/Emoji "Emoji") have been added, as well as additional
features related to emoji. Emojis appear 3x bigger if messages are sent with
up to three emojis and no text, the keyboard can now predict emojis to use,
and an emoji replacement feature attempts to match words in messages and
replace them with emojis of the same meaning.[140]

Since the [Game Center](/wiki/Game_Center "Game Center") app has been removed,
Messages now handles actions such as inviting friends to a game.[141]

[Read receipts](/wiki/Read_receipt "Read receipt") can now be turned on or off
for individual contacts rather than for all contacts.[142][143]

### Music[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=35 "Edit
section: Music")]

The Music app has been redesigned, with an emphasis placed on usability. The
"For You" section has been reorganized, with a playlist offering daily music
recommendations. The "New" tab has been renamed "Browse". A new tab for music
that has been downloaded called "Downloaded Music" has been added.[144]

Lyrics are viewable for songs in-app in iOS 10.[108][145] The "Search" tab
includes recent and trending searches.[146] An "Optimized Storage" option
removes downloaded music that the user hasn't played in a while.[147]

### News[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=36 "Edit
section: News")]

The [News](/wiki/News_\(Apple\) "News \(Apple\)") app, taking cues from the
Music layout, has been redesigned to incorporate bold headings and a
newspaper-esque layout in the redesigned "For You" tab. News also features
support for subscriptions and provides notifications for breaking
news.[148][149]

### Notes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=37 "Edit
section: Notes")]

[Notes](/wiki/Notes_\(Apple\) "Notes \(Apple\)") now has a collaboration
feature. This allows users to share a note and collaborate with other
users,[150] who can add and remove text from a note. Users tap a "round yellow
badge with a person and a plus sign" and can then send invitations through
text, email, or by link.[151]

### Photos[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=38 "Edit
section: Photos")]

Apple added [deep learning](/wiki/Deep_learning "Deep learning") capabilities
for sorting and searching in the Photos app.[152]

A new "Memories" feature can automatically recognize and compile related
photos and create short, shareable music videos.[153] [local facial
recognition](/wiki/Facial_recognition_system "Facial recognition system")
functionality was added to bundle together pictures of certain people.[154]

iOS 10 allows users to add doodles and text on a photo, using a new "Markup"
feature.[155][156] If the user edits a Live Photo using Markup, the image will
be turned into a still image.[157]

Live Photos can now be edited by the Photos app.[72] This allows users to trim
the clip, change the still frame, add a filter and add [digital image
stabilization](/wiki/Digital_image_stabilization "Digital image
stabilization") to the Live Photo so it is "buttery smooth".[108]

The app also has an upgraded auto-enhance feature and adds a "Brilliance"
slider.[158]

### Phone[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=39 "Edit
section: Phone")]

The Phone app can transcribe received [visual
voicemails](/wiki/Visual_voicemail "Visual voicemail").[159]

Siri can announce the name and phone number of incoming calls. The system can
mark suspected spam callers on the call screen upon incoming calls.[108]

Contacts can be enabled for "Emergency Bypass", in which the phone will always
make sounds and vibrations when receiving notifications from the chosen
contacts, even during Do Not Disturb mode.[160]

In the Favorites screen, users can customize what action each favorited
contact will enable from a click, including call, FaceTime, SMS, or
email.[111]

Users can save voicemails through [AirDrop](/wiki/AirDrop "AirDrop"),
[iMessage](/wiki/IMessage "IMessage"), [iCloud Drive](/wiki/ICloud_Drive
"ICloud Drive") and other apps through a share menu.[161]

### Safari[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=40 "Edit
section: Safari")]

[Apple Pay](/wiki/Apple_Pay "Apple Pay") is now available through the Safari
app.[162][163]

There is no limit to how many tabs users can have open at the same time.[164]

On supported [iPads](/wiki/IPad "IPad"), Safari has a unique "Split View" for
viewing two Safari browser tabs in 50/50 mode next to each other.[165]

Users can also search for keywords in specific tabs,[164] close all tabs with
a single click,[166] and reopen recently closed tabs by long-pressing on the
plus icon.[167] Users can also search for items in the Bookmarks and Reading
List.[168]

### TV[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=41 "Edit section:
TV")]

Included in the iOS 10.2 update is a "[TV](/wiki/TV_\(iOS_app\) "TV \(iOS
app\)")" app.[18] The app, which is only available in the United States,
offers a simple, unified experience of content from different video apps, as
long as each service supports the feature.[169][170] The new app replaces the
Videos app found in previous iOS versions.[171]

## Developer APIs[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=42
"Edit section: Developer APIs")]

iOS 10 gives third-party developers access to
[APIs](/wiki/Application_programming_interface "Application programming
interface") to three major iOS system apps and services: Siri, iMessage, and
Maps. Developers can:

  * Turn certain activities into Siri voice commands, allowing users to speak voice queries into the Siri personal assistant and Siri returning results from the respective apps. Apps that can integrate with Siri are limited to: sending messages, starting calls, sending and requesting payments, search for photos and videos, ordering [taxicab](/wiki/Taxicab "Taxicab") or [ride-sharing](/wiki/Carpool "Carpool") services, and managing workouts.[46][120]
  * Add dedicated apps to the iMessage App Store, that lets users add unique sticker packs, share rich content, or interact with certain app functions entirely within an iMessage conversation.[131]
  * Add extensions to Apple Maps, so apps with specific functionality useful in a map, such as a restaurant-booking app, can integrate with the mapping service to handle app functionality directly in the Maps app.[126]

iOS 10 allows third-party camera apps to capture [RAW](/wiki/Raw_image_format
"Raw image format") image format pictures.[172][173] Support for shooting
photos in Adobe's DNG RAW format is limited to devices with at least a 12MP
camera and a third-party app that supports it, as Apple did not enable the
feature in the native Camera app.[174][175]

iOS 10 allows [VoIP](/wiki/Voice_over_IP "Voice over IP") apps to have the
same functionality and interface as the Phone and FaceTime apps have, through
the use of a CallKit API.[176][177]

## Removed
functionality[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=43 "Edit
section: Removed functionality")]

Native support for the [VPN](/wiki/Virtual_private_network "Virtual private
network") protocol [PPTP](/wiki/Point-to-Point_Tunneling_Protocol "Point-to-
Point Tunneling Protocol") was removed. Apple recommends alternatives which it
considers to be more secure.[178][179]

The options to group notifications by app in Notification Center and customize
the order of notifications were removed.[71]

## Reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=44 "Edit
section: Reception")]

In his review, _[The Verge](/wiki/The_Verge "The Verge")_ 's Dieter Bohn wrote
that the new features introduced in iOS 10 are "an evolution of some of the
design and interaction ideas that Apple has been working on for a couple of
years". He wrote that iMessage is "becoming a platform all its own", and
although he liked that extensions mean access to information from apps without
needing to open the respective apps, he wrote that new iMessage interface is
difficult to understand and that the use of "third-party apps, stickers, crazy
confetti effects, and emoji all over the place" is a "nightmare", although
finishing with "Or maybe that's a wonderland, not a nightmare. Your call."
Regarding third-party support in Siri, he called it "great", while noting the
limited class of apps ("calls, messaging, payments, photos, ride-sharing apps,
some CarPlay systems, and workouts"), and that sometimes a button press was
required to complete the process. Beyond app integrations, he criticized Siri,
writing "Siri doesn't seem to have gotten a whole lot smarter than you
remember". Bohn enjoyed the new machine learning technology present in the
Photos app, writing that he was "impressed" by Apple's image recognition
technology, which he noted is done locally on the device, but did criticize
the error rate, where he compares the technology to [Google
Photos](/wiki/Google_Photos "Google Photos") as a step ahead. Bohn liked the
new designs for the Music and Maps apps, saying both the redesigns were "for
the better". Bohn particularly enjoyed the new lock screen, where he
highlighted that notification bubbles can be 3D Touch-ed to access more
information, all without needing to unlock the phone. Other small bits of new
features he liked included "deletable" apps, upgraded "widgets" when 3D Touch-
ing a home screen icon, and breaking news notifications in Apple News.
Overall, Bohn referred to iOS 10 as "Still a walled garden, but with more
doors".[180]

_[Engadget](/wiki/Engadget "Engadget")_ 's Devindra Hardawar wrote that iOS 10
is Apple "basically polishing a pearl". Hardawar noted that the major changes
in the release focus on features rather than the visual interface. He wrote
that the lock screen is now "far more customizable than before". He praised
the new features added to 3D Touch, writing that it "finally feels useful",
where he likes that "3D Touch works in almost every part of the OS". In regard
to iMessage, he wrote that it has new features that are "particularly useful",
including "Invisible ink" that obscures text in a conversation when others
might be looking, but criticized the user interface, writing that it "needs
some work". The "Memories" feature in the new Photos app "usually turned out
well", but wrote that "they're still clearly a work in progress". Hardawar
praised the new Apple Music app, but added that "really, anything is better
than the last iteration". He also liked lyrics support. He wrote that Siri's
third-party support was "actually starting to get useful", but did run into
accuracy issues. He finished by writing that although iOS 10 does add features
seen in Google's [Android operating system](/wiki/Android_\(operating_system\)
"Android \(operating system\)") before, the mobile industry is "shamelessly
getting "inspired" by the competition". His summary states that "iOS 10 is a
collection of useful changes to an already solid OS".[181]

In October 2016, a month after its initial release, 54% of iOS devices were
running iOS 10,[182] a "slightly slower migration" than for the release of iOS
9 in the preceding year, a result speculated by _[MacRumors](/wiki/MacRumors
"MacRumors")_ 's Tim Hardwick as being caused by an early release issue that
disabled some devices and may have "put some [users] off downloading the
update".[183] User adoption increased to 76% of active devices in January
2017,[184] 79% in February 2017,[185] 86% in June 2017,[186] 87% in July
2017,[187] and 89% in September 2017 before the release of [iOS
11](/wiki/IOS_11 "IOS 11").[188]

## Problems[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=45 "Edit
section: Problems")]

### Initial release bricking
issue[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=46 "Edit section:
Initial release bricking issue")]

The initial public release of iOS 10 on September 13, 2016 saw many
[iPhones](/wiki/IPhone "IPhone") and [iPads](/wiki/IPad "IPad") temporarily
disabled, or "bricked", by the over-the-air update, requiring bricked devices
to be connected to a [Mac](/wiki/Macintosh "Macintosh") or
[PC](/wiki/Microsoft_Windows "Microsoft Windows") with [iTunes](/wiki/ITunes
"ITunes") in order to retry the update or restore the device to factory
settings. Apple quickly released iOS 10.0.1,[8] and issued a statement: "We
experienced a brief issue with the software update process, affecting a small
number of users during the first hour of availability. The problem was quickly
resolved and we apologize to those customers."[189]

### Local backup encryption
issue[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=47 "Edit section:
Local backup encryption issue")]

In September 2016, it was discovered that the encryption of local iOS backups
made with [iTunes](/wiki/ITunes "ITunes") is weaker for iOS 10 devices than
for devices running iOS 9. Russian software firm [ElcomSoft](/wiki/ElcomSoft
"ElcomSoft") discovered that the iOS 10 backup process skips several security
checks, making it "approximately 2,500 times" faster to try passwords,
enabling 6 million password tries per second compared to the 2,400 password
tries per second for the same process ElcomSoft has used on iOS 9. The firm
stated that the impact is "severe".[190] Apple acknowledged the problem, said
it planned to issue a security update, but also stated that
[iCloud](/wiki/ICloud "ICloud") backups were not affected.[191] The iOS 10.1
update subsequently fixed the issue.[192]

### Battery shutdowns[[edit](/w/index.php?title=IOS_10&action=edit&section=48
"Edit section: Battery shutdowns")]

_The Next Web_ 's Juan Buis wrote in late November 2016 that "complaints are
shared [on Apple's support forums] about various iPhone models turning off
when the battery falls below a certain percentage", and blames the iOS 10.1.1
update. He further wrote that "the original post [on support forums] explains
that the phone dies when there’s 30 percent charge left, and many others have
since replied that they’re experiencing the same."[193] iOS 10.2, released in
December 2016, adds a [telemetry](/wiki/Telemetry "Telemetry") diagnostic tool
that Apple can use to report battery consumption, for diagnosing reported
issues with 30% battery shutdowns.[19] In February 2017, Apple released a
statement to _[TechCrunch](/wiki/TechCrunch "TechCrunch")_ , saying that the
iOS 10.2.1 update, released on January 23, had reduced the occurrence of
battery shutdowns by "more than 80%" on [iPhone 6S](/wiki/IPhone_6S "IPhone
6S") devices and "over 70%" on [iPhone 6](/wiki/IPhone_6 "IPhone 6") devices.
In full, the statement read:[194][195][196]

> With iOS 10.2.1, Apple made improvements to reduce occurrences of unexpected
> shutdowns that a small number of users were experiencing with their iPhone.
> iOS 10.2.1 already has over 50% of active iOS devices upgraded and the
> diagnostic data we've received from upgraders shows that for this small
> percentage of users experiencing the issue, we're seeing a more than 80%
> reduction in iPhone 6s and over 70% reduction on iPhone 6 of devices
> unexpectedly shutting down. We also added the ability for the phone to
> restart without needing to connect to power, if a user still encounters an
> unexpected shutdown. It is important to note that these unexpected shutdowns
> are not a safety issue, but we understand it can be an inconvenience and
> wanted to fix the issue as quickly as possible. If a customer has any issues
> with their device they can contact AppleCare.
